title: How to Wash a Cabbage Patch Doll's Hair

steps.headline: Remove the clothes from around the doll's head area.
steps.description: It might be easier to completely undress the doll.

steps.headline: Pour some warm water into a large bowl.
steps.description: Add some liquid hand soap or rub in normal hand washing soap until the water froths up. The soap must be gentle.

steps.headline: Wash the doll's hair.
steps.description: Tip the doll upside down and hold its hair into the washing bowl. Avoid dunking any of the head - just let the hair dangle in. Swish the hair using a circular motion.

steps.headline: Squeeze the doll's hair in one hand.
steps.description: Do this scrunching gently and repeatedly to remove build-up of grime.

steps.headline: Remove the doll's hair from the water.
steps.description: Lay the doll's head on a pre-folded towel to wait for rinsing.

steps.headline: Fill the bowl again with more warm water.
steps.description: Scrunch gently to remove the soap from the hair.

steps.headline: Remove the doll again and place back on the folded towel.
steps.description: Gently squeeze the hair and let the water run into the towel. When you have finished squeezing out the water, proceed to the next step.

steps.headline: Let the doll's hair air dry.
steps.description: Leaving the doll on the dry end of the towel (or use a new towel), spread out the doll's hair away from the rest of the doll. Leave it to dry. Overnight is good.

steps.headline: Finger brush and style.
steps.description: Once dry, you can try to restore some style to the hair, as wished.
